clinical_study.brief_title: Rasburicase Versus Allopurinol in Tumor Patients at Risk for Hyperuricemia and Tumor Lysis Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Single Agent Rasburicase for 5 Days Versus Sequential Treatment With Rasburicase From Day 1 Through 3 Followed by Oral Allopurinol From Day 3 Through 5 (Overlap on Day 3) Versus Single Agent Oral Allopurinol for 5 Days in the Management of Plasma Uric Acid in Adult Patients With Leukemia, Lymphoma, and Solid Tumor Malignancies at Risk for Hyperuricemia and Tumor Lysis Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a randomized, multi-center, open-label, parallel group study with three arms:
- Rasburicase alone
- Rasburicase followed by Allopurinol
- Allopurinol alone
The primary objective is to compare the adequacy of control of plasma uric acid concentration and the safety profile among the three arms.

detailed_description.textblock: After signing the informed consent and having met the inclusion criteria, patients will be randomized to 1 of the 3 arms and treated for a total duration of 5 days. Patients in all arms will receive chemotherapy beginning 4-24 hours after the first dose of rasburicase or allopurinol.

arm_group.description: Rasburicase alone given as a single agent for 5 days
Rasburicase alone given as a single agent from Day 1 through Day 3, followed by oral allopurinol given from Day 3 through Day 5 (Day 3 is an overlap)
Oral allopurinol alone given as a single agent for 5 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Meets high risk or at potential risk for tumor lysis syndrome (TLS):
A patient is at high risk for TLS if he/she presents with:
- Hyperuricemia of malignancy (plasma uric acid > 7.5 mg/dL);
- A diagnosis of very aggressive lymphoma/leukemia based on the Revised European-American Lymphoma (REAL) classification of lymphoma/leukemia;
- Acute myeloid leukemia (AML);
- Chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) in blast crisis; or
- High grade myelodysplastic syndrome (refractory anemia with excess blast, chronic myelomonocytic leukemia, and refractory anemia with excess blast in transformation) only if they have > 10% bone marrow blast involvement and are given aggressive treatment similar to AML.
A patient is at potential risk for TLS if he/she presents with:
- A diagnosis of aggressive lymphoma/leukemia based on the REAL classification of lymphoma/leukemia plus 1 or more of the following criteria:
- Lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) >= 2 x upper limit of normal (ULN) (IU/L)
- Stage III-IV disease
- Stage I-II disease with at least 1 lymph node/tumor > 5 cm in diameter
In addition to the above-mentioned eligibility criteria, the patients should have the following criteria:
2. Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status 0-3
3. Age >= 18 years
4. Life expectancy > 3 months
5. Negative pregnancy test (females of child bearing potential) and use of effective contraceptive method (for both males and females). A pregnancy test may be performed on serum or urine human chorionic gonadotropin (HCG).
6. Signed written informed consent

facility.name: University of Florida Health Science Center at Jacksonville
University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center

clinical_study.keyword: Solid Tumor cancers with hyperuricemia Hyperuricemia (cancer patients only)

group.title: Rasburicase
group.description: Rasburicase (0.20 mg/kg/day) given as a single agent for 5 days

group.title: Rasburicase + Allopurinol
group.description: Rasburicase (0.20 mg/kg/day) given alone as a single agent from Day 1 through Day 3, followed by oral allopurinol (300 mg/day) given from Day 3 through Day 5 (Day 3 is an overlap)

group.title: Allopurinol
group.description: Allopurinol (300 mg/day) given alone as a single agent for 5 days

participants_list.participants: Modified ITT population: ITT patients with at least 1 dose of study drug

outcome.title: Plasma Uric Acid Responder
outcome.description: Number of patients responding to treatment defined as plasma uric acid levels at Day 3 through Day 7 <7.5 mg/dl.

measure.title: Plasma Uric Acid Responder
measure.description: Number of patients responding to treatment defined as plasma uric acid levels at Day 3 through Day 7 <7.5 mg/dl.

outcome.title: Plasma Uric Acid
outcome.description: Area under the curve concentration versus time curve extrapolated to infinity (AUC) of plasma uric acid values
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the modified ITT-population with an evaluation of plasma uric acid AUC.

group.title: Rasburicase
group.description: Rasburicase (0.20 mg/kg/day) given as a single agent for 5 days

group.title: Rasburicase + Allopurinol

group.title: Allopurinol
group.description: Allopurinol (300 mg/day) given alone as a single agent for 5 days

measure.title: Plasma Uric Acid
measure.description: Area under the curve concentration versus time curve extrapolated to infinity (AUC) of plasma uric acid values
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the modified ITT-population with an evaluation of plasma uric acid AUC.

outcome.title: Time to Uric Acid Control
outcome.description: Time from the first dose of study drug to the time at which plasma uric acid concentrations were determined <=7.5 mg/dl, measured -4, 4, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120, and 144 hours after infusion.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on a subgroup of patients from the mITT-population with hyperuricemia immediately prior to the first dose of study drug.

reported_events.time_frame: Time from the first study drug intake until a maximum follow-up of 30 days after the last dose of antihyperuricemic treatment.
reported_events.desc: Reported events are treatment emergent adverse events within the time frame mentioned above.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If no publication has occurred within 12 months of the completion of the study, the Investigator shall have the right to publish/present independently the results of the study. The Investigator shall provide the Sponsor with a copy of any such presentation/publication for comment at least 30 days before any presentation/submission for publication. If requested by the Sponsor, any presentation/submission shall be delayed up to 90 days, to allow the Sponsor to preserve its proprietary rights.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: International Clinical Development, Clinical Study Director
